intro: Elatostema caudatum, commonly known as the hairy shield-plant, is a member of the Bromeliaceae family and is native to tropical regions of South America. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, hairy structures. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often hidden within the leaf rosette. Its leaves are typically fleshy and adapted to store water, which is a common trait among plants in arid environments. Elatostema caudatum is often grown as a houseplant due to its compact size and ability to thrive in bright, indirect light.
